turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I've been feeling really run down lately, constantly tired, and I'm getting headaches almost every day. Any ideas what could be causing it?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello. I understand you're experiencing fatigue and headaches. turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I try to eat pretty healthy, lots of fruits and veggies, and I aim for 7-8 hours of sleep. I'm pretty stressed from work, so I figured that's it. But, I don't know, my friend mentioned something about iron deficiency, and I'm suddenly worried that it might be something serious. How do I know if I have iron deficiency?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Iron deficiency can cause fatigue and headaches. Common symptoms include weakness, pale skin, and shortness of breath. To accurately determine if you have an iron deficiency, a blood test is necessary. The best course of action would be to consult with your doctor.
